title: Typewriter ID?
content:
Anyone know anything close to this:

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type_3904.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Two chunky sans serifs on business cards - ITC Eras, Futura {Yves, Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41625 "Go to previous forum topic") [stedman rounded surf brand ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41681 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Biff

comments.content:
Or .. you can visit here and perhaps find something even closer, thought FF Trixie is always a sure bet:

[http://www.vintagetype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.vintagetype.com/ "http://www.vintagetype.com")

That looks like an actual typewriter typed text. There are tons of fonts in the “eroded typewriter style” out there. Here are some examples:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/sunflower/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/sunflower/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/sunflower/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/obsolete/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/obsolete/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/obsolete/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/john-doe/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/john-doe/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/john-doe/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/erased-typewriter-2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/erased-typewriter-2/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/erased-typewriter-2/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-typewriter/")
Any ideas of something not ’eroded typewriter style’ which is similar to this?

Reminds me of our old ’Olympia Monika’ …

Check out [Techno Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/techno-script-ef/) by Elsner+Flake:

- has those oldstyle numerals
- is not eroded
- and, additionally has Eastern European language support

F

And: [FF Elementa](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706224309/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Elementa&site=d&sample_text=3.z%C3%A1%C5%99%C3%AD%201977%20Praha). A lot more styles/weights, though not so sure about the language coverage …

NOT eroded and quite widespread: Prestige Elite, Courier (New).  
More up-to-date: anything with ’mono’ in its name, eg FF Magda Clean Mono, OliveGreen Mono, FF Quadraat Mono, The Sans Mono.  
. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
